intro: Elatostema variolaminosum var. melanostictum, commonly known as the black-stained elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine, soft hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
